holidays.name: Wear Something Gaudy Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate tackiness by wearing the most colorful, over-the-top, and downright gaudy outfits you can find. Think clashing patterns, loud prints, and outrageous accessories!
holidays.origin: Apparently started as a fun challenge among friends to brighten up the drab autumn days with maximalist fashion.
holidays.funFact: Some participants have turned this day into an annual party theme, complete with a 'gaudiness contest' judged by the loudest cheers!

holidays.name: International Day for the Eradication of Poverty
holidays.description: A solemn day recognized by the United Nations dedicated to raising awareness and promoting efforts to eradicate poverty worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established in 1992 by the UN General Assembly, commemorating the 1987 gathering of people living in extreme poverty in Paris.
holidays.funFact: This day reminds us that despite progress, over 700 million people still live on less than $1.90 a day.

holidays.name: Clean Out Your Refrigerator Day
holidays.description: A practical, if less glamorous, observance encouraging people to clean and organize their fridge before the busy holiday season begins.
holidays.origin: Probably started by picky housekeepers or food safety enthusiasts aiming to reduce food waste.
holidays.funFact: Did you know? Cleaning your fridge regularly can save up to 20% on your energy bill!

holidays.name: Sweetest Day
holidays.description: Mostly celebrated in the Midwestern United States, this day is like a second Valentine’s Day where people give sweets, cards, and small gifts to loved ones and friends.
holidays.origin: Originated in 1921 by candy makers and social workers in Cleveland, Ohio, wanting to spread kindness and affection.
holidays.funFact: Sweetest Day was initially a charity effort to cheer up life’s less fortunate before becoming a widely marketed gift-giving holiday.
